title.value: Graph Fourier MMD for Signals on Graphs
title.justification: Exact match to the title listed in the document.
title.quote: Graph Fourier MMD for Signals on Graphs

extractions.description: This paper proposes Graph Fourier MMD (GFMMD), a novel distance measure between distributions and signals on graphs. The method is analytically solved, scale invariant, and applicable to disconnected graphs. The paper demonstrates GFMMD on graph benchmark datasets and single-cell RNA-sequencing data, where it identifies meaningful gene clusters.

type.justification: The paper demonstrates the proposed method on real datasets like graph benchmarks and single-cell RNA-sequencing data.
type.quote: We showcase application of GFMMD to single cell RNA-sequencing data.

name.justification: The primary focus is on developing and applying methods to compare distributions on graphs.
name.quote: While numerous methods have been proposed for computing distances between probability distributions in Euclidean space, relatively little attention has been given to computing such distances for distributions on graphs.

name.justification: The paper involves methods and metrics that are relevant for learning on graphs.
name.quote: Here, we address the question of how to organize and compare signals on graphs in such a way that accounts for geometric structure on their underlying space.

name.justification: The paper includes applications involving single-cell RNA-sequencing data to identify gene modules.
name.quote: In the single cell setting, we focus on the application of embedding a set of genes on a graph of cells, as created from single cell RNA-sequencing data.

name.justification: The entire paper revolves around the introduction and evaluation of this new model for computing distances between signals on graphs.
name.quote: Here, we propose Graph Fourier MMD (GFMMD), a novel distance between distributions and signals on graphs.

is_contributed.justification: Graph Fourier MMD is introduced in this paper as a novel contribution.
is_contributed.quote: Here, we propose Graph Fourier MMD (GFMMD), a novel distance between distributions and signals on graphs.

is_executed.justification: The model was applied to real datasets like single-cell RNA-sequencing data, indicating computational execution.
is_executed.quote: In the latter, we use the GFMMD-based gene embeddings to find meaningful gene clusters.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares GFMMD to other methods such as the Earth Mover's Distance and Diffusion EMD.
is_compared.quote: Graph MMD outperforms all other methods in accuracy and speed.

referenced_paper_title.justification: GFMMD is introduced in this paper, so it doesn't reference an external paper for the model.

name.justification: The dataset is specifically mentioned and used for the single-cell RNA sequencing experiments in the study.
name.quote: To demonstrate the utility of Graph Fourier MMD for biological analysis, we leverage publicly available single-cell RNA sequencing dataset of CD8-positive T cells.

referenced_paper_title.value: Massively parallel digital transcriptional profiling of single cells
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset used is referenced to an external study on single-cell RNA sequencing.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We leverage publicly available single-cell RNA sequencing dataset of CD8-positive T cells [21].

name.justification: PyGSP is explicitly mentioned regarding its use for graph-related computing tasks.
name.quote: We can take the earlier signals from the grid graph (from pygsp's built in library) and combine them into a new signal.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The library is used within the study and is not attributed to an external paper.
